title: What is Python?
explanation: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity and readability.

title: Which HTTP method is idempotent?
explanation: PUT is idempotent - calling it multiple times with the same data produces the same result.

title: What is the time complexity of binary search?
explanation: Binary search has O(log n) time complexity because it divides the search space in half each iteration.

title: Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In First Out)?
explanation: Stack follows LIFO principle where the last element added is the first one to be removed.

title: What does SQL stand for?
explanation: SQL stands for Structured Query Language, used for managing relational databases.

title: Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
explanation: Quick Sort has O(n log n) average-case complexity, better than O(nÂ²) algorithms like Bubble Sort.

title: What is a RESTful API?
options: An architectural style for web services
explanation: REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style for designing networked applications.

title: Which of the following is NOT a JavaScript data type?
explanation: JavaScript doesn't have a 'Character' type; single characters are just strings of length 1.

title: What is the purpose of Git?
explanation: Git is a distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code.

title: What does CSS stand for?
explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used for styling HTML documents.
